intro: Sabicea trichochlamys, commonly known as the hairy-chalmed sabicea, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with hairy surfaces and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in lowland rainforests. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its ecosystem, supporting various insect and bird species.
